title: When would slavery have ended in America if we had failed to gain independence from Great Britain? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Likely not until late in the 19th Century. Britian in theory, had slavery, but by the late 18th Century its practice in Britian was not wide spread, and there were many free black people in Britian at the time, and serving in the British Navy. The British Parliament outlawed the practice of Slavery, I think in 1830, and by 1835 had directed the Royal Navy to stop slave trading on the high seas. The Royal Navy would stop ships and free any on board slaves. This action stopped most of the slave trade and caused much diplomatic unrest with USA. This naval action was later extended to the South Pacific in 1870s to nip in the but the practice of “black birding" where Pacific Islanders were taken to work as “indentured labour" in Queensland sugar plantations.

Slavery was terminated in the entire British Empire in 1833.And had the rebels/patriots been defeated,slavery would have been terminated in 1833 in what is now the US.Same way it was in Canada+the West Indies at the same time.
If America had still been a British colony, all of its slaves would have had to be freed on 1 August 1834.
